[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 95]
Reasoning: **Strategic Assessment: Blind Select - The Head**

Okay, so I'm in Round 10, Ante 5/8. This is the "Blind Select" stage, and the boss is "The Head," meaning all Heart cards are debuffed. I've got $23 to work with, and the target score for this round is 22,000. My current build revolves around Three of a Kind (3OAK), which is leveled to Level 1.

My Joker lineup is pretty solid: Juggler gives me the extra hand size, Wily Joker adds +100 chips for a 3OAK, Shoot the Moon provides +13 Mult for each Queen held and +10 for holo, Half Joker gives +20 Mult if I play a hand of 3 cards or less, and Card Sharp triples my Mult if I replay the same hand. Antimatter gives me access to a max of 6 Jokers.

The crucial thing here is understanding how the Heart debuff works with the Jokers. Debuffed cards *still* count toward the 3OAK, but they give no chips and don't trigger "when scored" or "when held" abilities. Importantly, Shoot the Moon relies on having Queens in hand, and Heart Queens won't trigger that particular effect. But I can play Heart Queens and still complete the 3OAK hand.

Let's break down the scoring. A basic 3OAK will give me about 130-160 chips (depending on the card ranks) plus 3 base mult. Add to that Wily Joker's +100 chips, the Half Joker's +20 mult, and the Shoot the Moon Holo's +10 mult and each Queen in hand adds another +13 mult. If I then replay the hand, Card Sharp will triple the mult from the second play.

So, let's say I go with non-Queen cards (3x 10s). The first play nets around 9,440. Then I repeat for 28,320. Total: 37,760, which far exceeds the 22,000 target.

Even if I draw *only* Heart Queens, I can still get pretty close to the 22,000 target. In that worst-case scenario, the first play would result in 5,280, and the second 15,840 for a total of 21,120.

Now, I *do* have a "Director's Cut" voucher that lets me reroll the boss for $10. I have $23 right now. Is it worth it? The Heart debuff is only a problem if I depend on Heart Queens, which is unlikely given I have 4 suits. Even with 0 good Queens, I'm almost there in two hands. I can find other Queens by discarding if necessary.

In terms of the Joker order, I need to make sure the multiplicative effect of Card Sharp is last. Since all the additive mults apply before, the order is optimal: Wily Joker, Half Joker, Shoot the Moon. Card Sharp is in the correct slot.

The optimal Joker order will trigger all the additive mults before applying the X3 mult.

So, I'm going to `play_round` as is. There's no pressing need to reroll. I'll take my chances and focus on finding non-Heart Queens. The build is strong. I am comfortable with this plan.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.

**My Play for This Round**

Okay, here's the deal. I'm in Ante 5/8, Round 11, facing "The Head" boss blind. I need 22,000 chips, and I've only got 6,900, so I'm 15,100 short. With only 3 hands and discards left, I'm under pressure. Let's see... the boss blind means all Hearts are debuffed. I need to make some strategic plays here.

I've got the following jokers in my hand: Juggler (hand size +1), Wily Joker (+100 for 3 of a Kind), Shoot the Moon (Holo +10 mult, +13 mult per Queen), and Half Joker (+20 if hand has 3 or fewer cards), and Card Sharp (X3 Mult if poker hand already played this round). The key is the Card Sharp. In the previous turn, I played a Three of a Kind (10s), which means any subsequent 3 of a Kind will get tripled in mult.

So, here's my hand right now. 3 of Spades, Queen of Hearts (debuffed), 8 of Hearts (debuffed), 6 of Hearts (debuffed), Queen of Clubs (Gold Card, worth $3 if held), 7 of Clubs, 6 of Clubs, 8 of Diamonds, 2 of Diamonds.

My immediate thought is to create a Three of a Kind to trigger Card Sharp again. I've got a pair of 8s (8H, 8D) and a pair of 6s (6H, 6C) and a pair of Queens (QH, QC). So I need one more card to have a 3 of a Kind. The Queen of Clubs also has a potential +13 Mult (for Shoot the Moon, and it's a Gold card worth $3. The debuffed cards won't give me any extra chips, and the heart cards are debuffed anyway.

With 3 discards, I need to focus on drawing those cards. Let's see...I need to optimize my discards. I need to find the 3rd card for the 3OAK.

I will discard: 3 of Spades, Queen of Hearts, 7 of Clubs, 2 of Diamonds and focus on making either a 3 of a Kind with either 8s, 6s or Queens.

I am holding onto: 8H (debuffed, but can contribute to 3OAK), 8D, and QC (a Gold Card that can get the $3 and the extra +13 Multi). This will give me a base mult, a potential +10 for the Holo +20 for Half Joker and the Shoot the Moon +13. This will put my total chips over the top. So...

Let's quickly calculate the expected value. If I make a 3OAK: 30 base, +100 from Wily Joker, scoring cards (6, 8, or queen), a +10 for Holo (Shoot the Moon), +20 for half joker, and X3 from Card Sharp. The Queen of Clubs gives me the +13 mult for Shoot the Moon. I will be far over my threshold.

So, let's discard those cards. Wait. Let me just refine those discards. Since 8H, 6C, and QC all can contribute to a good hand, maybe I should discard the debuffed cards and a junk card instead. That makes more sense.

Looking at the new hand: Now I've got 8H (debuffed), QC, 6C and 8D. I discard 3 Spades, Queen of Hearts, 6 Hearts, 7 of Clubs, 2 of Diamonds, this keeps pairs intact. I have 8 outs for a Three of a Kind from the deck. The probability is decent of hitting it. Let's hit the button and see what we get!
